summary.title: Zeke Web Application
summary.description:
StellarPay Digital Banking is a fast-growing fintech company that is developing a web-based digital payment platform to provide secure and seamless financial transactions for its customers. This platform will enable users to create accounts, link bank cards, send and receive money, pay for goods and services, and manage their financial transactions in real time.

Due to the handling of sensitive financial data, including personal identification details, bank account information, transaction logs, and API communications with payment gateways, StellarPay is prioritising security before launching the platform. The company has decided to conduct a threat modelling exercise to proactively identify and mitigate potential cyber threats before deployment.

threats.title: Threat 5
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a customer to gain access.

threats.title: threat 6
threats.description: Attacker floods login endpoint, causing service outage.

threats.title: Threat 7
threats.description: Teller actions are untraceable
threats.mitigation: Audit logs with user IDs and timestamps

threats.title: threat 8
threats.description: Unauthorized person logs in as a teller.

threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: threat 21
threats.description: Customer PII is accessed without authorization

threats.title: threat 22
threats.description: Customer records are maliciously altered.

threats.title: threat 23
threats.description: Log entries are changed to cover up fraud.

threats.title: threat 24
threats.description: Transactions aren't traceable to a user

threats.title: threat 25
threats.description: Security events are deleted or changed.

threats.title: threat 26
threats.description: Logs reveal sensitive information

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: Threat 1
threats.description: unauthorized login
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication), rate-limiting login attempts, use secure password storage

threats.title: threat 13
threats.description: Excessive login attempts crash the service

threats.title: threat 14
threats.description: no record of log in attempts
threats.mitigation: log all login events with their User ID and IP address

threats.title: Threat 2
threats.description: (API key/data leaks) Use token expiration, encrypt data in transit, limit response data.
threats.mitigation: Use TLS with integrity checks, mutual TLS between services, detect protocol anomalies

threats.title: threat 15
threats.description: API payloads are modified or injected

threats.title: threat 16
threats.description: APIs are put under stress as there could be an excessive request

threats.title: Threat 3
threats.description: with transactions Use database constraints, transactional integrity checks, and cryptographic signing.
threats.mitigation: use database constraints, transactional integrity checks and cryptographic signing

threats.title: threat 17
threats.description: User denies initiating a transaction

threats.title: threat 18
threats.description: Unauthorised access to transaction details.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data in transit and at rest

threats.title: Threat 4
threats.description: Validate recipients before sending, tokenize sensitive data in messages.
threats.mitigation: digitally sign all notifications, verify integrity before delivery

threats.title: threat 19
threats.description: Sensitive content in alerts is leaked
threats.mitigation: Role-based access control for viewing alerts

threats.title: threat 20
threats.description: Alert system is spammed or overloaded.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: threat 29
threats.description: No logs of user interactions or server activity
threats.mitigation: Enable server and application logs with timestamps

threats.title: threat 30
threats.description: Attacker exploits a vulnerability to execute commands or gain access
threats.mitigation: Server hardening, patching, least privilege on services

threats.title: threat 27
threats.description: An attacker mimics the legitimate server

threats.title: threat 28
threats.description: Server is flooded with HTTP requests, degrading or halting service.
threats.mitigation: Web Application Firewall (WAF), DDoS protection, rate limiting
